section.para: A Shipping Guarantee (SG) is an undertaking by a bank to the shipping owner or agent of a vessel, to release goods to the importer pending receipt of the original Bill of Lading. This helps the importer to clear the purchased goods under a Letter of Credit or a simple documentary collection while waiting for shipping documents to be presented. Hence it can for instance save the client from storage charges levied by the port authorities due to late arrival of the shipping documents or delays in clearance of the goods. Some Letters of Indemnity could also be handled through this module.

The module of enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the importer and applicant) to initiate new Shipping Guarantee requests, send them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently follow up these transactions by sending and receiving updates on the records to and from the bank.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "SG" and "Shipping Guarantee" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Shipping Guarantee Landing Page
section.para: The Shipping Guarantee Landing page displays a list of SGs that are in various stages of an SG life cycle. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.
The following image illustrates the Shipping Guarantee landing page:

The following button enables you to initiate a new Shipping Guarantee from scratch.
Request Shipping Guarantee
Enter the desired terms of a new Shipping Guarantee and submit them to the Issuing Bank of your choice.

The following ribbon items enable you perform various actions on individual SGs or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Draft
Lists all the SGs in draft state and also the transactions that checker has returned for improvement.
Actions
Lists all the Shipping Guarantee transactions on which the bank has requested client action.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing Shipping Guarantee transactions that are awaiting client approval.
The Authorise action item is available only for a checker user.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to Approve or Return though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing Shipping Guarantee that are awaiting bank approval.
Live
Lists all the approved Shipping Guarantee records and the expired Shipping Guarantee records by the bank.
Rejected
Lists all the rejected Letter of Credit records by the bank. The status given to such SGs is "Not Processed".
Closed
Lists all the Shipping Guarantee transactions that have been marked as purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Event, Entity, Beneficiary Name, Currency and Expiry Date. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant SGs. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched.

You can perform the following actions on the listed SGs:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of SGs
CSV Download: Download the list of SGs displayed on the dashboard. Click on the Download icon to list the formats in which the files can be downloaded. You can download Current Data or Full Data.
Current Data: Downloads the transactions displayed on screen.
Full Data: Downloads all the transactions available under a particular status tab like Draft, Rejected and more.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed SGs.
